flawed_nl_solution:
If he buys 2 bottles, the price drops to $20 per bottle so they cost 2*20 = $<<2*20=40>>40
He can get 80 loads of laundry per bottle and he bought 2 bottles so that's 80*2 = <<80*2=160>>160 loads of laundry
The detergent cost $40 and he will be able to wash 160 loads of laundry so each load costs 40/160 = $<<40/160=2.5>>2.5

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 0.25, not 2.5. It appears the decimal point was misplaced.
